intro: Cryptochaete andicola, commonly known as the Andean cryptochaete, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its foliage is usually narrow and grass-like, with small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its ecosystem.
